BOX=1.description: Property. Define box, sphere, cylinder, cone  All shapes are defined to have their bounding boxes centered around 0,0,0.

type.description: Property. The type of the shape

dimensions.description: Property. The dimensions of the shape

BOX_X=0.description: Property. The meaning of the shape dimensions: each constant defines the index in the 'dimensions' array For the BOX type, the X, Y, and Z dimensions are the length of the corresponding sides of the box.

SPHERE_RADIUS=0.description: Property. For the SPHERE type, only one component is used, and it gives the radius of the sphere.

CYLINDER_HEIGHT=0.description: Property. For the CYLINDER and CONE types, the center line is oriented along the Z axis.  Therefore the CYLINDER_HEIGHT (CONE_HEIGHT) component of dimensions gives the height of the cylinder (cone).  The CYLINDER_RADIUS (CONE_RADIUS) component of dimensions gives the radius of the base of the cylinder (cone).  Cone and cylinder primitives are defined to be circular. The tip of the cone is pointing up, along +Z axis.
